org.apache.activemq.core.server

Interface ActiveMQServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.apache.activemq.core.server.ActiveMQComponent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveMQServerImpl

    public interface ActiveMQServer
extends org.apache.activemq.core.server.ActiveMQComponent
    This interface defines the internal interface of the ActiveMQ Server exposed to other components of the server.

    This is not part of our public API.

    Author:
    Tim Fox, Andy Taylor

    • Method Detail

      • setIdentity

        void setIdentity(String identity)
        Sets the server identity.

        The identity will be exposed on logs. It may help to debug issues on the log traces and debugs.

        This method was created mainly for testing but it may be used in scenarios where you need to have more than one Server inside the same VM.

      • waitForActivation

        boolean waitForActivation(long timeout,
                          TimeUnit unit)
                   throws InterruptedException
        Wait for server initialization.
        Parameters:
        timeout -
        unit -
        Returns:
        true if the server was already initialized or if it was initialized within the timeout period, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        See Also:
        CountDownLatch#await(long, TimeUnit)

      • createSharedQueue

        void createSharedQueue(org.apache.activemq.api.core.SimpleString address,
                       org.apache.activemq.api.core.SimpleString name,
                       org.apache.activemq.api.core.SimpleString filterString,
                       boolean durable)
                throws Exception
        Creates a shared queue. if non durable it will exist as long as there are consumers. Notice: the queue won't be deleted until the first consumer arrives.
        Parameters:
        address -
        name -
        filterString -
        durable -
        Throws:
        Exception
